title: Add videos section to the portfolio website

requirements.text: Add a reusable portfolio video gallery component that renders a responsive grid of HTML5 videos sourced from static files under the frontend public assets (e.g., `/assets/videos/...`) and matches the existing Cyberâ€‘Minimalism glassmorphism styling.
acceptanceCriteria: A new React component exists for displaying videos (grid/cards) and does not depend on the backend.
Videos are loaded from static paths (served by the frontend) and play using the native HTML5 <video> element with controls.
The gallery layout is responsive (1 column on small screens, multiple columns on larger screens) and uses existing glass/neon hover styling patterns.
Each video has an accessible text label (title/caption or aria-label) and does not rely on autoplay by default.

requirements.text: Integrate the new video gallery into the existing site UI by adding a 'Videos' section on the About page (below the existing MediaPortraits section) with an English section heading and short descriptive text consistent with the current typography.
acceptanceCriteria: The About page (`frontend/src/pages/AboutContactPage.tsx`) displays a new 'Videos' section beneath the portrait images.
The section heading and any helper text are in English.
The page remains visually consistent with the current theme and spacing on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Ensure video loading and playback are performance-aware: do not autoplay, support poster thumbnails when provided, and avoid layout shifts by reserving aspect-ratio space in the UI cards.
acceptanceCriteria: No videos autoplay on page load; playback begins only via user interaction.
Video cards reserve space using a fixed aspect ratio so the grid does not jump when media loads.
If a poster image is specified for a video entry, it is applied to the <video> element; otherwise a styled fallback placeholder is shown.
Rendering the video section does not break the existing smooth scroll / route transitions and respects reduced-motion preferences (no forced motion effects).

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI component sources must be composed, not modified).
Do not modify Internet Identity hooks in immutable paths (`frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts` / `.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Do not introduce third-party video hosting/streaming integrations; serve videos as static frontend assets.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for static video embedding.
nonGoals: Building a backend video upload system or storing video binaries on the canister.
Live streaming, DRM, subtitles/transcoding pipeline, or adaptive bitrate streaming (HLS/DASH).
